cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the evaluation of research performance in multi-disciplinary institutions, which involves aggregating performance measures from various fields. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including digital libraries (cs.DL), computational biology (cs.CY), information retrieval (cs.IR), cryptography and security (cs.CR), and social and information networks (cs.SI). However, since the paper focuses on the evaluation of scientific production in universities, we can eliminate some sub-categories that are less relevant, such as computer vision (cs.CV) and robotics (cs.RO). Among the remaining sub-categories, we can rank them based on their relevance to the topic and the frequency of papers related to research evaluation.
